video.title: Web Application Ethical Hacking - Penetration Testing Course for Beginners
video.description:
Learn web app penetration testing. You will learn pentesting techniques, tools, common attacks and more. The tools covered in the course include Burp Suite, Nikto, Dirbuster, curl, sublist3r, nmap, and many others.

This course was originally live streamed weekly on Twitch and built from lessons learned in the previous week. 

🎥 Course created by The Cyber Mentor. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0ArlFuFYMpEewyRBzdLHiw
🐦 The Cyber Mentor on Twitter: https://twitter.com/thecybermentor

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:52) Episode 1 - Enumeration
⌨️ (1:20:28) Episode 2 - Enumeration, XSS, and UI Bypassing
⌨️ (2:19:40) Episode 3 - XSS, SQL Injection, and Broken Access Control
⌨️ (3:13:30) Episode 4 - XXE, Input Validation, Broken Access Control, and More XSS
⌨️ (4:13:40) Episode 5 - SQL Injections and Live Bug Bounty Hunting

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.text: I have been renting a dedicated server from WELL-WEB net hosting provider for more than a year, the prices for unmetered 1Gb/s from ~ $140 had no serious problems during this time, the traffic is unlimited and the speed is guaranteed !! Love and appreciate the client! Price-quality at height. Enjoyed support - very professional, bulletproof,  fast and without any questions. It is not the first time that I rent a dedicated server in this area, I know what difficulties you may encounter, so there were none. Now have server with 10 gb/s - with 1 year payment period him cost - 1100$/mon. Free give KVM and IPMI. When paying for a year, I pay make discounts sometimes up to 30%! topLevelComment.author: Yudhistra Verma
topLevelComment.text:
Resources from the video::


* Juice Shop:

- https://github.com/bkimminich/juice-shop#setup
- https://bkimminich.gitbooks.io/pwning-owasp-juice-shop/content - Working Link: https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/

* OWASP Testing Guides:

- https://www.owasp.org/images/1/19/OTGv4.pdf
- https://github.com/tanprathan/OWASP-Testing-Checklist

* Bug Bounties:

- https://bugcrowd.com/
- https://hackerone.com/
- https://www.synack.com/red-team/
- https://www.guru99.com/bug-bounty-programs.html

* Education:

- https://www.elearnsecurity.com/course/web_application_penetration_testing/ - Working link: https://elearnsecurity.com/product/ewpt-certification/
- https://portswigger.net/web-security
- https://www.giac.org/certification/web-application-penetration-tester-gwapt
- https://www.amazon.com/Web-Application-Hackers-Handbook-Exploiting/dp/1118026470?&linkCode=ll1&tag=&linkId=b07b375d3f121a97468b47f73a2b208a&language=en_US&ref_=as_li_ss_tl

topLevelComment.author: Xtreme-Designs
topLevelComment.text:
If you wanna start your career as a bug bounty hunter then don't waste your time money n efforts. Just focus on these core crucial TOPICS to become master in website hacking penetration testing n offcourse bug bounty hunting...it took me 12 months to reach here as NO BODY will tell you TRUTH or RIGHT WAY to get success. So just FOCUS n FOCUS.

Topics are:

Linux Basics (Use parrot sec os) it's light fast n reliable
Types of Websites Attack Vectors
Web Cache Poisoning
HTTP Request Smuggling
Host Header Injection
XML External Entity Injection
SSRF
OS Command Injection
Directory Traversal
Access Control Vulnerabilities
Authentication Issues
SQL Injection
Cross Site Scripting
Information disclosure
Business Logic Vulnerabilities
Required Tools payload scripts exploits CVE etc...

Happy hunting guys.
Sharing is caring.
Free education for all.
Learn Earn n Grow 
🇵🇰🤝❤💙💚💐👍🇵🇰

topLevelComment.author: dejo095
topLevelComment.text:
Lol nothing he is showing here is working for me. I add foxy proxy for firefox, and burp suite catches absoluetely nothing, interceptor is ON. I have to set manual proxy in firefox for burp suite to be able to catch anything, but then firefox cant open any page saying its potential security risk, accept the security risk and continue.

UPDATE:
Manual proxy setting now works for me, but I ha to turn on "Proxy DNS when using socks5" option in firefox at the bottom where  you setup proxy.

and in burp suite, theres a Options button on the Proxy tab, there you can check on which ip and port Burp is listening.
Also on proxy tab, on first caught request you have to click Forward button for webpage to continue navigating...

Damn, I got this all from another youtube tutorial
